meanings.sent1: Yesterday, we cabbed to the airport for our flight.
meanings.sent2: She always cabbed to work because she didn't have a car.
meanings.sent3: The family cabbed to the amusement park and had a blast on the rides.
meanings.sent4: The students cabbed through the city, taking in the sights and sounds.
meanings.sent5: As the rain poured down, they cabbed home to stay dry and cozy.

meanings.definition: To provide transportation in a taxi.
meanings.sent1: The taxi driver cabbed the passengers to their hotel.
meanings.sent2: He cabbed people around the city all day, earning a living.
meanings.sent3: The friendly driver cabbed a group of tourists to the museum.
meanings.sent4: She cabbed her friends to the concert, ensuring they arrived on time.
meanings.sent5: The cab driver cabbed customers to various destinations with a smile.
